DataElement.preferredDefinition: Maximal thickness in millimeters (mm), measured with an ocular micrometer at a right angle to the adjacent normal skin. The upper point of reference is the granular layer of the epidermis of the overlying skin or, if the lesion is ulcerated, the base of the lesion (ulcer). The lower reference point is the deepest point of tumor invasion (ie, the leading edge of a single mass or an isolated group of cells deep to the main mass).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Cutaneous Melanoma Tumor Cell Invasion Depth
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A malignant neoplasm derived from cells that are capable of forming melanin._Tumor Cell Invasion is the local spread of tumor cells of a malignant neoplasm through infiltration or destruction of adjacent tissue; for epithelial neoplasms, invasion signifies infiltration beneath the epithelial basement membrane.:The extent downward or inward.  The perpendicular measurement from the surface downward to determine deepness.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant neoplasm derived from cells that are capable of forming melanin.

Concepts.definition: A primary melanoma arising from atypical melanocytes in the skin.  Precursor lesions include acquired and congenital melanocytic nevi, and dysplastic nevi.  Several histologic variants have been recognized, including superficial spreading melanoma, acral lentiginous melanoma, nodular melanoma, and lentigo maligna melanoma.

Property.preferredDefinition: Tumor Cell Invasion is the local spread of tumor cells of a malignant neoplasm through infiltration or destruction of adjacent tissue; for epithelial neoplasms, invasion signifies infiltration beneath the epithelial basement membrane.:The extent downward or inward.  The perpendicular measurement from the surface downward to determine deepness.

Concepts.definition: The local spread of tumor cells of a malignant neoplasm through infiltration or destruction of adjacent tissue; for epithelial neoplasms, invasion signifies infiltration beneath the epithelial basement membrane.
The extent downward or inward; the perpendicular measurement from the surface downward to determine deepness.
